Mental health resources would be redirected to address the root causes of mental illness, such as poverty, trauma, and societal factors.
Mental health professionals would need to adapt their skills to support individuals in maintaining good mental health and preventing future mental health issues.
Mental health insurance coverage and access to care would become less of an issue, as there would be no need for ongoing treatment.
Mental health stigma would decrease as mental illness would no longer be seen as a chronic condition, but rather as a rare occurrence.
Mental health education and awareness campaigns would shift from raising awareness of existing conditions to promoting mental health and well-being.
